title: Very heavy showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: The Meteorology Department says the deep depression over the southwest Bay of Bengal was located to 100 km northeast of Trincomalee at around 2.30 a.m. of November 28, 2024.

title: 59-year-old man dies after falling into water-filled drain in Koswatta
byline: A 59-year-old resident of the Madumulla area in Uda Pussellawa has reportedly died after falling into a water-filled drain in the Mawathagama Industrial Zone in Koswatta.

title: EC deliberates on dates for LG elections
byline: The Election Commission has focused its attention on determining suitable dates for the local government elections.

title: Severe weather affects 20 districts, over 276,000 people impacted
byline: Adverse weather conditions have severely impacted 20 districts across the island, with total of 80,642 families in 166 Divisional Secretariat divisions currently affected, according to the Disaster Management Center (DMC).

title: Lebanon’s Hezbollah vows to continue resistance after ceasefire
byline: Lebanon’s Hezbollah on Wednesday vowed to continue its resistance and support Palestinians, including fighters, a day after a ceasefire deal, between the group and Israel was announced.

title: Sri Lanka welcomes ceasefire between Israel and Lebanon – Foreign Ministry
byline: Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs has expressed its support for the recently announced ceasefire between Israel and Lebanon.

title: Singapore PM Wong congratulates Sri Lankan counterpart Harini
byline: Singapore Prime Minister Lawrence Wong has written to his Sri Lankan counterpart Harini Amarasuriya to congratulate her on her appointment, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA) said on Thursday (Nov 28).

title: 2024 A/L Exam to recommence on Dec. 04
byline: The Examinations Department has announced that the 2024 G.C.E. Advanced Level Examination has been temporarily postponed until December 03 due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: Moody’s places Sri Lanka’s rating under review for upgrade after bond-exchange offer
byline: Moody’s has placed Sri Lanka’s Ca long-term foreign currency rating on review for an upgrade, the credit ratings agency said on Wednesday, following the government’s bond-exchange offer that aims to complete the restructuring of international bonds.

title: HIV cases on the rise among Sri Lankan youth – health expert
byline: The National STD/AIDS Control Programme (NSACP) of the Ministry of Health says that HIV infections among the country’s youth has increased owing to factors such as the use of mobile phones and modern technology to find partners, as well as the lack of proper sex education.

title: Law College entrance exam and another exam postponed
byline: The Examinations Department has announced the postponement of the 2024 Sri Lanka Law College General Entrance Examination, originally scheduled for December, due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions in the country.

title: Traffic movement on A-9 road resumes after floods
byline: The A-9 main road to Jaffna which was closed at Omanthai due to floods has now been reopened for traffic movement, police said.

title: President Dissanayake holds discussion with World Bank Group President
byline: A virtual meeting was held yesterday (27) between President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and the President of the World Bank Group (WBG) Mr. Ajay Banga at the Presidential Secretariat, to discuss Sri Lanka’s future development priorities.

title: India’s parliament suspended temporarily after row over allegations against Adani group
byline: Both houses of Indian parliament were suspended temporarily on Thursday within minutes of opening as opposition lawmakers disrupted proceedings for the third day this week seeking a discussion on allegations against the Adani Group.

title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs is denied bail for a third time
byline: Sean “Diddy” Combs will remain in jail after a judge rejected his latest attempt for release while the rapper and music producer awaits trial on charges of sex trafficking and racketeering conspiracy.

title: Death toll due to adverse weather climbs to 12
byline: According to Sri Lanka’s Disaster Management Center (DMC), a total of 12 deaths have been reported due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions in the country.

title: Tusker ‘Deegadanthu 1’ dies from electrocution
byline: The infamous tusker known as ‘Deegadanthu 1’, one of the elephants with the longest tusks in the country, often spotted roaming the Kala Wewa National Park, has been electrocuted to death after coming into contact with an electric fence set up in front of a house in Andiyagala, Hinguruwewa.

title: China to test new-gen Beidou network rivalling GPS in 2027
byline: China plans in 2027 to test the next generation of Beidou, the country’s answer to the U.S.-owned GPS navigation system, state broadcaster CCTV reported on Thursday.

title: Ampara tractor incident:  Driver’s assistant surrenders, driver’s body recovered
byline: The assistant of the tractor driver involved in the tragic tractor accident at Karaitivu in Ampara, who was previously reported missing, has surrendered to the Karaitivu Police Station.

title: Warrant against MP Archchuna recalled after appearing at court
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today ordered to recall the arrest warrant issued against Jaffna District Independent Member of Parliament Archchuna Ramanathan after he failed to appear before the court in relation with an incident of assaulting an individual after causing a traffic accident.

title: Main suspect in Rs. 75 million cash robbery fled to Dubai?
byline: Another suspect involved in the recent robbery in Minuwangoda of over Rs. 75 million in cash from a private company providing cash in transit services has reportedly fled to Dubai.

title: SriLankan Airlines wins Tamil Nadu tourism’s top honor
byline: SriLankan Airlines has been recognized as the ‘Best Airline Partner’ by Tamil Nadu Tourism, as announced on Thursday.

title: ‘Petti Malli’ arrested with heroin in Payagala
byline: Payagala Police have arrested Dissanayakage Chaminda, also known as ‘Petti Malli’, a resident of the Koshena area who was allegedly involved in trafficking heroin to Payagala and several other areas.
